key_features: Instant reward redemption with an extensive selection of airline and hotel partners via HSBC Singapore mobile app
Accelerated earn rate: up to 2.4 miles for your spending
Travel privileges: Complimentary travel insurance coverage (including COVID-19), 4 x complimentary airport lounge visits for primary cardholders and guests of primary cardholders and more
Split flexibly: Split your purchases across a range of flexible tenors that suits your needs with HSBC Instalment Plans
Receive complimentary access to ENTERTAINER with HSBC app, with over 1,000 worldwide 1-for-1 deals on dining, lifestyle and travel.

At MoneySmart, we strive to keep our information accurate and up to date. This information may be different from what you see when you visit a financial institution, service provider, or specific product site. MoneySmart shall not be liable to compensate the Customer should the information is not as updated as our Partner.

eligibility: MoneySmart Exclusive gift is applicable for New-to-HSBC cardholders only
Customers need to apply through MoneySmart to be eligible
For HSBC TravelOne Card the first-year annual fee of S$196.20 (incl. GST) must be paid to be eligible for the promotion.
Applicants need to provide HSBC their consent to receive marketing and promotional materials from HSBC at the time of submitting their application
Spend a min. of S$800 in Qualifying Transactions from Card Account Opening Date to the end of the following calendar month.
Log into your MoneySmart account and submit your claim by 30th April 2025

fees.annual_fee_waiver: For the second year onwards, we'll waive the Annual Fee for your card if you spend more than S$25,000 per year
fees.annual_interest_rate: Effective Rate: 26.9% p.a. (minimum), Minimum Charge: S$2.50
fees.late_payment_fee: S$100 if the minimum payment is not received on or before the Payment Due Date
fees.minimum_monthly_repayment: 100% of the monthly instalment plan amount and interest/fees, 1% of remaining outstanding balances, excess amount above your credit limit (if your account is overlimit) or $50 (in the currency of your account), whichever is greater

minimum_income.singaporean_pr: Singaporean/PR Minimum Income To apply for an HSBC TravelOne card, you must be aged 21 or above and have a minimum annual income of: SGD30,000 (Singaporean or Permanent resident or SGD40,000 (self-employed or commission-based Singaporean or Permanent Resident)
minimum_income.non_singaporean: Non-Singaporean Minimum Income To apply for an HSBC TravelOne card, you must be aged 21 or above and have a minimum annual income of: SGD40,000 (foreigner residing in Singapore)
